text: Hi,  In asset Management 02 example. we could manage a record (row) level  access control (to AssetsOwnership table) based on the account ID to different users using attributes configured in membersrvc.yaml. I s it possible to manage field level (column) access as well ? Does membership services support this feature  and How?
Another topic - I've raised an issue on JIRA for admin enrollment from HFC client (nodejs script). Can someone pls help on this.

<@U1LES78TT> :
```
CORE_PEER_PKI_ECA_PADDR=membersrvc:7054
CORE_PEER_PKI_TCA_PADDR=membersrvc:7054
CORE_PEER_PKI_TLSCA_PADDR=membersrvc:7054
```

in core.yaml the default is localhost
<@U1F3CQ2HX>  - I added a comment to the jira issue but basically your test cannot connect to the membership services URL you provided

on your other question - fabric really does not have built-in support for row or field level access control.  You can use the primitives to get the calling user and attributes, but just like the asset mgmt sample uses custom logic for row level access control, you would have to do the same to implement field level access control
Thanks <@U0PB67X4K> . Yup. Got it. Will give it a shot. Thanks a lot!
